Founders

Phil Knight

nickname: the Shoe dog

Born: February 24, 1938 (age 82 years) Portland, Oregon, United States

Net worth:Net worth: 37.7 billion USD (2020)

Philip Hampson Knight, is an American business magnate and philanthropist. A native of Oregon, he is the co-founder and current chairman emeritus of Nike.

The Shoe Dog

Bill Bowerman

Not a track coach but a professor of competitive response

Born: February 19, 1911, Portland, Oregon, United States

Died: December 24, 1999, Fossil, Oregon, United States

William Jay "Bill" Bowerman was an American track and field coach and co-founder of Nike, Inc. Over his career, he trained 31 Olympic athletes, 51 All-Americans, 12 American record-holders, 22 NCAA champions and 16 sub-4 minute milers.

Jeff Johnson

nickname: full time employee number one

Luck of information

Jeff Johnson, Nike's first official employee, is notable for many long-lasting efforts.In January of 1967, Johnson opened a running specialty store, Blue Ribbon Sports (Nike's original name) at 3107 Pico Boulevard in Santa Monica, California.
